author: John Henrik Clarke
quote: A people's relationship to their heritage is the same as the relationship of a child to its mother.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Love sought is good\\, but given unsought\\, is better.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: They do not love that do not show their love.

author: Taylor Swift
quote: Relationships are like traffic lights. And I just have this theory that I can only exist in a relationship if it's a green light.

author: Bipasha Basu
quote: Any relationship should have love\\, and if there is no love\\, it is better to call off a relationship. People say that love happens only once\\, but I don't believe in it because for me\\, if one relationship doesn't work\\, you should move on and seek love in another relationship. Who knows; you might find love in the second relationship.

author: Lonny Price
quote: I think there is a price to being alone\\, and there is a price to being in a relationship. It all depends on which price you want to pay - but none of them are free.

author: Michael Ian Black
quote: The thing that I think is the most important is taking moments to express your appreciation to your partner. A thank you or a quick kiss can go a long way toward affirming your relationship and commitment to each other. That's not hard to do even when you're juggling insane careers and three kids.

author: Nick Cannon
quote: I think one of the most important things in a relationship is caring for your significant other through good times and bad.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: If you want a love message to be heard\\, it has got to be sent out. To keep a lamp burning\\, we have to keep putting oil in it.

author: Taylor Swift
quote: You have people come into your life shockingly and surprisingly. You have losses that you never thought you'd experience. You have rejection and you have learn how to deal with that and how to get up the next day and go on with it.

author: Anais Nin
quote: I\\, with a deeper instinct\\, choose a man who compels my strength\\, who makes enormous demands on me\\, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness\\, who does not believe me naive or innocent\\, who has the courage to treat me like a woman.

author: Taylor Swift
quote: I can't deal with someone wanting to take a relationship backward or needing space or cheating on you. It's a conscious thing; it's a common-sense thing.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion\\, enmity\\, worship\\, love\\, but no friendship.

author: Piet Mondrian
quote: Everything is expressed through relationship. Colour can exist only through other colours\\, dimension through other dimensions\\, position through other positions that oppose them. That is why I regard relationship as the principal thing.

author: BJ the Chicago Kid
quote: You can't be afraid to be honest and to be yourself. We all have imperfections and fall short at some point. Showing your human side creates a sensitivity\\, openness and trust. That's the beginning of the demise in a relationship - not being honest and not being you.

author: Carl Rogers
quote: In my early professional years I was asking the question: How can I treat\\, or cure\\, or change this person? Now I would phrase the question in this way: How can I provide a relationship which this person may use for his own personal growth?

author: Tadao Ando
quote: When you look at Japanese traditional architecture\\, you have to look at Japanese culture and its relationship with nature. You can actually live in a harmonious\\, close contact with nature - this very unique to Japan.

author: Mike Murdock
quote: Each relationship nurtures a strength or weakness within you.

author: Joseph Prince
quote: God doesn't want us to have rigid rituals with Him. In the new covenant\\, He is more interested in having a relationship with us.

author: A. Philip Randolph

author: Chris Pine
quote: Fear runs our lives. It doesn't matter who you are. You have to understand your relationship with fear. Whether you're scared of getting into a relationship; or taking the new job; or a confrontation - you have to size fear up.

author: Toni Collette
quote: The better you know yourself\\, the better your relationship with the rest of the world.

author: Elon Musk
quote: I think it matters whether someone has a good heart.

author: Barbara De Angelis
quote: You never lose by loving. You always lose by holding back.

author: Peter Zumthor
quote: My relationship to plants becomes closer and closer. They make me quiet; I like to be in their company.

author: Angela Davis

author: Logan Lerman

author: Eckhart Tolle

author: Helen Fisher

author: Benny Cassette

We tried to make it work but always had trouble maintaining a real relationship because we were both so caught up with work\\, life\\, and everything else that at the time seemed like it was the priority.

author: Harold S. Geneen
quote: Every company has two organizational structures: The formal one is written on the charts; the other is the everyday relationship of the men and women in the organization.

author: Willa Cather

author: Robert Anthony
quote: The one who loves the least\\, controls the relationship.

author: Buddha
quote: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire\\, men cannot live without a spiritual life.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Prayer is the key of the morning and the bolt of the evening.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quote: You cannot believe in God until you believe in yourself.

author: Barack Obama
quote: We need to reject any politics that targets people because of race or religion. This isn't a matter of political correctness. It's a matter of understanding what makes us strong. The world respects us not just for our arsenal; it respects us for our diversity and our openness and the way we respect every faith.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: When I admire the wonders of a sunset or the beauty of the moon\\, my soul expands in the worship of the creator.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Science without religion is lame\\, religion without science is blind.

author: Abraham Lincoln

author: Jon Katz

Politics are ugly\\, religion is struggling\\, technology is stressful\\, and the economy is unfortunate. What's one thing that we have in our lives that we can depend on? A dog or a cat loving us unconditionally\\, every day\\, very faithfully.

author: Malala Yousafzai
quote: There should be no discrimination against languages people speak\\, skin color\\, or religion.

author: Buddha
quote: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.

author: Dalai Lama
quote: This is my simple religion. There is no need for temples; no need for complicated philosophy. Our own brain\\, our own heart is our temple; the philosophy is kindness.

author: Soren Kierkegaard
quote: Prayer does not change God\\, but it changes him who prays.

author: Martin Luther
quote: To be a Christian without prayer is no more possible than to be alive without breathing.

author: Madonna Ciccone
quote: Be strong\\, believe in freedom and in God\\, love yourself\\, understand your sexuality\\, have a sense of humor\\, masturbate\\, don't judge people by their religion\\, color or sexual habits\\, love life and your family.

author: Dalai Lama
quote: My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.

author: Muhammad Ali
quote: I believe in the religion of Islam. I believe in Allah and peace.

author: John O'Donohue
quote: The human soul is hungry for beauty; we seek it everywhere - in landscape\\, music\\, art\\, clothes\\, furniture\\, gardening\\, companionship\\, love\\, religion\\, and in ourselves. No one would desire not to be beautiful. When we experience the beautiful\\, there is a sense of homecoming.

author: Ronald Reagan
quote: Within the covers of the Bible are the answers for all the problems men face.

author: Radhanath Swami
quote: Religion is meant to teach us true spiritual human character. It is meant for self-transformation. It is meant to transform anxiety into peace\\, arrogance into humility\\, envy into compassion\\, to awaken the pure soul in man and his love for the Source\\, which is God.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quote: God is to be worshipped as the one beloved\\, dearer than everything in this and next life.

author: Josephine Baker
quote: Surely the day will come when color means nothing more than the skin tone\\, when religion is seen uniquely as a way to speak one's soul\\, when birth places have the weight of a throw of the dice and all men are born free\\, when understanding breeds love and brotherhood.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: I love you when you bow in your mosque\\, kneel in your temple\\, pray in your church. For you and I are sons of one religion\\, and it is the spirit.

author: Woodrow Wilson
quote: There is no higher religion than human service. To work for the common good is the greatest creed.

author: Muhammad Ali
quote: Rivers\\, ponds\\, lakes and streams - they all have different names\\, but they all contain water. Just as religions do - they all contain truths.

author: Kirk Cameron
quote: It is my goal to love everyone. I hate no one. Regardless of their race\\, religion\\, their proclivities\\, the desire of their heart and how they want to live their life and the decisions that they make. I can even respect people's decisions and lifestyle choices just as I hope they have the courtesy to respect my decisions and my choices.

author: Jesus Christ
quote: So I say to you\\, Ask and it will be given to you; search\\, and you will find; knock\\, and the door will be opened for you.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
quote: A thorough knowledge of the Bible is worth more than a college education.

author: Vladimir Putin
quote: Terrorism has no nationality or religion.

author: Martin Luther King\\, Jr.
quote: Every man lives in two realms: the internal and the external. The internal is that realm of spiritual ends expressed in art\\, literature\\, morals\\, and religion. The external is that complex of devices\\, techniques\\, mechanisms\\, and instrumentalities by means of which we live.

author: Condoleezza Rice
quote: The essence of America - that which really unites us - is not ethnicity\\, or nationality or religion - it is an idea - and what an idea it is: That you can come from humble circumstances and do great things.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
quote: All religion\\, my friend\\, is simply evolved out of fraud\\, fear\\, greed\\, imagination\\, and poetry.

author: Frederick Douglass

author: Buddha
quote: However many holy words you read\\, however many you speak\\, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Gentleness\\, self-sacrifice and generosity are the exclusive possession of no one race or religion.

author: Galileo Galilei
quote: The Bible shows the way to go to heaven\\, not the way the heavens go.

author: Karl Marx
quote: Religion is the sigh of the oppressed creature\\, the heart of a heartless world\\, and the soul of soulless conditions. It is the opium of the people.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: I like the religion that teaches liberty\\, equality and fraternity.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: I never considered a difference of opinion in politics\\, in religion\\, in philosophy\\, as cause for withdrawing from a friend.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Jesus is ideal and wonderful\\, but you Christians - you are not like him.

author: Thomas Paine
quote: The World is my country\\, all mankind are my brethren\\, and to do good is my religion.

author: Roger Ebert
quote: Parents and schools should place great emphasis on the idea that it is all right to be different. Racism and all the other 'isms' grow from primitive tribalism\\, the instinctive hostility against those of another tribe\\, race\\, religion\\, nationality\\, class or whatever. You are a lucky child if your parents taught you to accept diversity.

author: Dalai Lama
quote: We can live without religion and meditation\\, but we cannot survive without human affection.

author: Booker T. Washington
quote: At the bottom of education\\, at the bottom of politics\\, even at the bottom of religion\\, there must be for our race economic independence.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: Religion is what keeps the poor from murdering the rich.

author: Karl Marx
quote: Religion is the opium of the masses.

author: Galileo Galilei
quote: I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense\\, reason\\, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use.

author: Martin Luther King\\, Jr.
quote: Any religion that professes to be concerned about the souls of men and is not concerned about the slums that damn them\\, the economic conditions that strangle them and the social conditions that cripple them is a spiritually moribund religion awaiting burial.

author: Feisal Abdul Rauf
quote: The truth is that killing innocent people is always wrong - and no argument or excuse\\, no matter how deeply believed\\, can ever make it right. No religion on earth condones the killing of innocent people; no faith tradition tolerates the random killing of our brothers and sisters on this earth.

author: Malcolm X
quote: America needs to understand Islam\\, because this is the one religion that erases from its society the race problem. Throughout my travels in the Muslim world\\, I have met\\, talked to\\, even eaten with people who in America would have been considered 'white\\,' but the 'white' attitude had been removed from their minds by the religion of Islam.

author: Lady Gaga
quote: Music is one of the most powerful things the world has to offer. No matter what race or religion or nationality or sexual orientation or gender that you are\\, it has the power to unite us.

author: Voltaire
quote: When it is a question of money\\, everybody is of the same religion.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Your daily life is your temple and your religion. When you enter into it take with you your all.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Heaven is under our feet as well as over our heads.

author: Dalai Lama
quote: There is no need for temples\\, no need for complicated philosophies. My brain and my heart are my temples; my philosophy is kindness.

author: Christopher Hitchens
quote: Religion is part of the human make-up. It's also part of our cultural and intellectual history. Religion was our first attempt at literature\\, the texts\\, our first attempt at cosmology\\, making sense of where we are in the universe\\, our first attempt at health care\\, believing in faith healing\\, our first attempt at philosophy.

author: C. S. Lewis
quote: Aim at heaven and you will get earth thrown in. Aim at earth and you get neither.

author: Moses
quote: See\\, I have set before you this day life and good\\, death and evil... I have set before you life and death\\, blessing and curse; therefore choose life.

author: Abraham Joshua Heschel
quote: Worship is a way of seeing the world in the light of God.

author: William Ralph Inge

author: Nat Turner

author: Pope Francis
quote: If one has the answers to all the questions - that is the proof that God is not with him. It means that he is a false prophet using religion for himself. The great leaders of the people of God\\, like Moses\\, have always left room for doubt. You must leave room for the Lord\\, not for our certainties; we must be humble.

author: Lucille Ball
quote: I have an everyday religion that works for me. Love yourself first\\, and everything else falls into line.

author: Nikki Haley
quote: We must fix our broken immigration system. That means stopping illegal immigration. And it means welcoming properly vetted legal immigrants\\, regardless of their race or religion. Just like we have for centuries.

author: ASAP Rocky
quote: Fashion is almost like a religion\\, for me at least.

author: Richard Dawkins
quote: I am against religion because it teaches us to be satisfied with not understanding the world.

author: Mary Daly
quote: Almost everything has been stolen from us by the patriarchy. Our creativity has been stolen\\, our creative energies\\, our religion. I want it back.

author: Desmond Tutu

author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
quote: Religion is regarded by the common people as true\\, by the wise as false\\, and by the rulers as useful.

author: Richard M. Nixon

author: Jesus Christ
quote: For God so loved the World that he gave his only Son\\, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.

author: John Quincy Adams

author: Jay Parini
quote: We are a nation of immigrants\\, a quilt of many colors\\, and we've managed over more than two centuries to create a way of life that allows for a reasonable degree of upward mobility\\, that prizes individual liberty\\, promotes freedom of religion and genuinely values equal rights for all citizens.

author: Richard Dawkins
quote: Religion is capable of driving people to such dangerous folly that faith seems to me to qualify as a kind of mental illness.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: I never knew how to worship until I knew how to love.

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: The more powerful and original a mind\\, the more it will incline towards the religion of solitude.

author: Arlen Specter
quote: The First Amendment freedom of religion is as important today as when the Bill of Rights was first written.

author: Walter Koenig
quote: Religious tolerance is something we should all practice; however\\, there have been more persecution and atrocities committed in the name of religion and religious freedom than anything else.

author: Dayananda Saraswati
quote: No human heart is denied empathy. No religion can demolish that by indoctrination. No culture\\, no nation and nationalism - nothing can touch it because it is empathy.

author: Martin Luther
quote: To gather with God's people in united adoration of the Father is as necessary to the Christian life as prayer.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: It is in our lives and not our words that our religion must be read.

author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah
quote: You are free; you are free to go to your temples\\, you are free to go to your mosques or to any other place or worship in this State of Pakistan. You may belong to any religion or caste or creed - that has nothing to do with the business of the State.

author: Edmund Burke
quote: Superstition is the religion of feeble minds.

author: Elizabeth I
quote: There is one thing higher than Royalty: and that is religion\\, which causes us to leave the world\\, and seek God.

author: Rodrigo Duterte
quote: God does not discriminate against people\\, regardless of color\\, religion\\, social class\\, or gender and sexual preferences.

author: Anais Nin
quote: When we blindly adopt a religion\\, a political system\\, a literary dogma\\, we become automatons. We cease to grow.

author: Voltaire
quote: Superstition is to religion what astrology is to astronomy the mad daughter of a wise mother. These daughters have too long dominated the earth.

author: Joseph Campbell
quote: God is a metaphor for that which transcends all levels of intellectual thought. It's as simple as that.

author: Thomas A. Edison
quote: Religion is all bunk.

author: Martin Luther
quote: War is the greatest plague that can afflict humanity\\, it destroys religion\\, it destroys states\\, it destroys families. Any scourge is preferable to it.

author: Sojourner Truth
quote: Religion without humanity is very poor human stuff.

author: Cory Booker
quote: Tolerance says I am just going to stomach your right to be different. That if you disappear from the face of the earth\\, I am no better or worse off. But love - love knows that every American has worth and value\\, no matter what their background\\, race\\, religion\\, or sexual orientation.

author: Bertrand Russell
quote: I say quite deliberately that the Christian religion\\, as organized in its Churches\\, has been and still is the principal enemy of moral progress in the world.

author: Shahid Khan
quote: I've lived the American Dream and had a great life. Immigration and religion and racial tolerance are the foundation of this country.

author: Elie Wiesel
quote: Wherever men and women are persecuted because of their race\\, religion\\, or political views\\, that place must - at that moment - become the center of the universe.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: Indians today are governed by two different ideologies. Their political ideal set in the preamble of the Constitution affirms a life of liberty\\, equality and fraternity. Their social ideal embodied in their religion denies them.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: If I had to choose a religion\\, the sun as the universal giver of life would be my god.

author: Tyler\\, The Creator
quote: For the record\\, I don't worship the devil. I just hate religion.

author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
quote: Any time scientists disagree\\, it's because we have insufficient data. Then we can agree on what kind of data to get; we get the data; and the data solves the problem. Either I'm right\\, or you're right\\, or we're both wrong. And we move on. That kind of conflict resolution does not exist in politics or religion.

author: Benito Mussolini
quote: Fascism is a religion. The twentieth century will be known in history as the century of Fascism.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: My religion consists of a humble admiration of the illimitable superior spirit who reveals himself in the slight details we are able to perceive with our frail and feeble mind.

author: Mona Sutphen
quote: Most good relationships are built on mutual trust and respect.

author: Bruce Lee
quote: Knowledge will give you power\\, but character respect.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: If we lose love and self respect for each other\\, this is how we finally die.

author: Paulo Coelho
quote: I have seen many storms in my life. Most storms have caught me by surprise\\, so I had to learn very quickly to look further and understand that I am not capable of controlling the weather\\, to exercise the art of patience and to respect the fury of nature.

author: Barack Obama
quote: We need to reject any politics that targets people because of race or religion. This isn't a matter of political correctness. It's a matter of understanding what makes us strong. The world respects us not just for our arsenal; it respects us for our diversity and our openness and the way we respect every faith.

author: Bryant H. McGill
quote: One of the most sincere forms of respect is actually listening to what another has to say.

author: Laurence Sterne

author: Jackie Robinson

author: Renee Olstead
quote: The biggest ingredient in a best friend is someone whose actions you respect and who you can truly be yourself around.

author: Richard Bach
quote: The bond that links your true family is not one of blood\\, but of respect and joy in each other's life.

author: Ezra Taft Benson

author: Dalai Lama
quote: When you practice gratefulness\\, there is a sense of respect toward others.

author: Orison Swett Marden
quote: There can be no failure to a man who has not lost his courage\\, his character\\, his self respect\\, or his self-confidence. He is still a King.

author: Vince Lombardi

author: Kina Grannis
quote: In finding love\\, I think it's important to be patient. In being in a relationship\\, I think it's important to be honest\\, to communicate\\, to respect and trust\\, and to strive to give more than you take.

author: Malcolm X
quote: Be peaceful\\, be courteous\\, obey the law\\, respect everyone; but if someone puts his hand on you\\, send him to the cemetery.

author: Robin S. Sharma
quote: Be a warrior when it comes to delivering on your ambitions. And a saint when it comes to treating people with respect\\, modeling generosity\\, and showing up with outright love.

author: Orhan Pamuk
quote: Life is short\\, and we should respect every moment of it.

author: Taylor Swift
quote: We don't need to share the same opinions as others\\, but we need to be respectful.

author: Michelle Obama
quote: We learned about gratitude and humility - that so many people had a hand in our success\\, from the teachers who inspired us to the janitors who kept our school clean... and we were taught to value everyone's contribution and treat everyone with respect.

author: James D'arcy
quote: There are lots of people I admire and respect\\, but I don't necessarily want to be like them. I'm too happy being myself.

author: Clint Eastwood
quote: Respect your efforts\\, respect yourself. Self-respect leads to self-discipline. When you have both firmly under your belt\\, that's real power.

author: Michael Jordan
quote: The game of basketball has been everything to me. My place of refuge\\, place I've always gone where I needed comfort and peace. It's been the site of intense pain and the most intense feelings of joy and satisfaction. It's a relationship that has evolved over time\\, given me the greatest respect and love for the game.

author: Vince Lombardi
quote: Football is a great deal like life in that it teaches that work\\, sacrifice\\, perseverance\\, competitive drive\\, selflessness and respect for authority is the price that each and every one of us must pay to achieve any goal that is worthwhile.

author: Confucius
quote: Without feelings of respect\\, what is there to distinguish men from beasts?

author: Malcolm X
quote: I have more respect for a man who lets me know where he stands\\, even if he's wrong\\, than the one who comes up like an angel and is nothing but a devil.

author: Ingrid Newkirk

All deserve that the human animal afford them the respect of being cared for with great consideration for those interests or left in peace.

author: Henri Frederic Amiel
quote: There is no respect for others without humility in one's self.

author: Jasmine Guinness
quote: Be kind\\, don't judge\\, and have respect for others. If we can all do this\\, the world would be a better place. The point is to teach this to the next generation.

author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

author: Ewa Kopacz

author: Benjamin E. Mays

author: Shailene Woodley
quote: I think the most important thing in life is self-love\\, because if you don't have self-love\\, and respect for everything about your own body\\, your own soul\\, your own capsule\\, then how can you have an authentic relationship with anyone else?

author: Jewell Parker Rhodes
quote: Prejudice is sinful. All blood flows red. And the most harmful and foolish kind of prejudice is prejudice against yourself. Every woman is your sister\\, and every woman needs her sisters. So try to give other women the courtesy of your compassion\\, respect\\, and forgiveness. Love yourself despite - and because of - your flaws.

author: Ranbir Kapoor
quote: I believe that working with good people matters because then the work environment is good. If there is a sense of respect and belief among the people you work with\\, that is when good work is done.

author: John Cena
quote: I'm the one person who wears the words 'hustle\\, loyalty\\, respect' on my T-shirts and merchandise. My audience is children. It's very flattering to see a kid wear your T-shirt; it's even more flattering to have a dad come up to you and say\\, 'I watch you with my kid. Keep doing what you're doing. You're a role model for my son.'

author: Taylor Swift
quote: I love making new friends and I respect people for a lot of different reasons.

author: Odell Beckham\\, Jr.
quote: As you get older\\, you grow and mature\\, and that should never stop. As soon as you stop growing\\, you're done living. I'll always be growing\\, forever learning\\, forever taking in advice from people I deeply respect.

author: Kirk Cameron
quote: It is my goal to love everyone. I hate no one. Regardless of their race\\, religion\\, their proclivities\\, the desire of their heart and how they want to live their life and the decisions that they make. I can even respect people's decisions and lifestyle choices just as I hope they have the courtesy to respect my decisions and my choices.

author: Johnny Iuzzini

author: Allan Hamilton

author: Barack Obama
quote: Let us remember we are all part of one American family. We are united in common values\\, and that includes belief in equality under the law\\, basic respect for public order\\, and the right of peaceful protest.

author: Dr. Seuss
quote: A person's a person\\, no matter how small.

author: Jackie Robinson
quote: Many people resented my impatience and honesty\\, but I never cared about acceptance as much as I cared about respect.

author: C. S. Lewis
quote: Literature adds to reality\\, it does not simply describe it. It enriches the necessary competencies that daily life requires and provides; and in this respect\\, it irrigates the deserts that our lives have already become.

author: Russell Simmons
quote: Respect your parents. What they tell you is true. Hard work\\, dedication and faith will get you anything. Imagination will drive itself. You can get anything you want\\, but you have to have faith behind all your ideas. Stick to your goals and have an undying faith.

author: Kate Middleton
quote: My parents taught me about the importance of qualities like kindness\\, respect\\, and honesty\\, and I realize how central values like these have been to me throughout my life.

author: John Cena
quote: Be loyal to those who are loyal to you. And respect everyone\\, even your enemies and competition.

author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

author: Louis D. Brandeis

author: Justin Trudeau
quote: Openness\\, respect\\, integrity - these are principles that need to underpin pretty much every other decision that you make.

author: Katy Perry
quote: I'm kind of a good girl - and I'm not. I'm a good girl because I really believe in love\\, integrity\\, and respect. I'm a bad girl because I like to tease. I know that I have sex appeal in my deck of cards. But I like to get people thinking. That's what the stories in my music do.

author: Jane Addams
quote: Civilization is a method of living\\, an attitude of equal respect for all men.

author: Aretha Franklin
quote: We all require and want respect\\, man or woman\\, black or white. It's our basic human right.

author: Kiana Tom
quote: Treat everyone with respect and kindness. Period. No exceptions.

author: Blake Lively
quote: I've been so lucky to work with such great people: people that are such hard workers and have such a respect and appreciation for one another.

author: John Lynch
quote: We will not agree on every issue. But let us respect those differences and respect one another. Let us recognize that we do not serve an ideology or a political party; we serve the people.

author: Stephen Covey
quote: Moral authority comes from following universal and timeless principles like honesty\\, integrity\\, treating people with respect.

author: Barry Bonds
quote: Everyone in society should be a role model\\, not only for their own self-respect\\, but for respect from others.

author: Divyanka Tripathi
quote: These haters are too less in number when compared to the millions who support me. I look at all those beautiful people who always stand by me. I respect them\\, and they equally respect me.

author: Hope Solo
quote: One thing I've learned through all the ups and downs is that if you're doing things right\\, then you have a core group of people. Not just a core group like your homies or your buddies\\, but a group of people that has a good influence on you\\, who you respect and admire\\, and you know that if they're on your side\\, you're doing something right.

author: James H. Douglas\\, Jr.
quote: Our deep respect for the land and its harvest is the legacy of generations of farmers who put food on our tables\\, preserved our landscape\\, and inspired us with a powerful work ethic.

author: Robert Mugabe
quote: Cooperation and respect for each other will advance the cause of human rights worldwide. Confrontation\\, vilification\\, and double standards will not.

author: Albert Camus
quote: In order to exist\\, man must rebel\\, but rebellion must respect the limits that it discovers in itself - limits where minds meet\\, and in meeting\\, begin to exist.

author: Tupac Shakur
quote: I think I'm a natural-born leader. I know how to bow down to authority if it's authority that I respect.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete\\, everybody will respect you.

author: Ban Ki-moon
quote: True security is based on people's welfare - on a thriving economy\\, on strong public health and education programmes\\, and on fundamental respect for our common humanity. Development\\, peace\\, disarmament\\, reconciliation and justice are not separate from security; they help to underpin it.

author: Audre Lorde
quote: I write for those women who do not speak\\, for those who do not have a voice because they were so terrified\\, because we are taught to respect fear more than ourselves. We've been taught that silence would save us\\, but it won't.

author: Robert Stack
quote: A great chef is an artist that I truly respect.

author: Nash Grier
quote: I accept you\\, and you get the same respect from me whether you are black\\, white\\, gay straight\\, Asian\\, bisexual\\, Australian\\, tall\\, fat\\, whatever it is. We are all people\\, and I look at the people of the world the same way\\, as my brothers and sisters.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: Being brilliant is no great feat if you respect nothing.

author: Steve Jobs
quote: I have a great respect for incremental improvement\\, and I've done that sort of thing in my life\\, but I've always been attracted to the more revolutionary changes. I don't know why. Because they're harder. They're much more stressful emotionally. And you usually go through a period where everybody tells you that you've completely failed.

author: Julian Assange
quote: Journalism should be more like science. As far as possible\\, facts should be verifiable. If journalists want long-term credibility for their profession\\, they have to go in that direction. Have more respect for readers.

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
quote: This world of ours... must avoid becoming a community of dreadful fear and hate\\, and be\\, instead\\, a proud confederation of mutual trust and respect.

author: Ryan Holiday
quote: We all have goals: We want to matter. We want to be important. We want to have freedom and power to pursue our creative work. We want respect from our peers and recognition for our accomplishments. Not out of vanity or selfishness\\, but of an earnest desire to fulfill our personal potential.

author: Rumi
quote: The gifts of lovers to one another are\\, in respect to love\\, nothing but forms; yet\\, they testify to invisible love.

author: Baltasar Gracian
quote: Respect yourself if you would have others respect you.

author: Colin Kaepernick
quote: I realize that men and women of the military go out and sacrifice their lives and put their selves in harm's way for my freedom of speech and my freedoms in this country\\, and my freedom to take a seat or take a knee\\, so I have the utmost respect for them\\, and I think what I did was taken out of context and spun a different way.

author: Abraham Joshua Heschel
quote: Self-respect is the fruit of discipline; the sense of dignity grows with the ability to say no to oneself.

author: David Robinson
quote: Your peers will respect you for your integrity and character\\, not your possessions.

author: Arjun Rampal
quote: I believe that fitness needs to come from within you. You need to respect your body. Only then will you have the zeal to maintain it. For me\\, keeping fit is a part of my lifestyle.

author: Marcia Fudge
quote: We respect our elders. There is wisdom that comes from experience\\, and I am not going to stop learning from wise counsel.

author: Gamaliel Bailey
quote: Never respect men merely for their riches\\, but rather for their philanthropy; we do not value the sun for its height\\, but for its use.

author: Juan Pablo Galavis
quote: Different people have different opinions\\, and it's okay to respect all of them.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: If you have ten thousand regulations you destroy all respect for the law.

author: Harry Styles
quote: I grew up with just my mum and sister\\, so I respect women a lot.

author: Richard M. Nixon
quote: In the long term we can hope that religion will change the nature of man and reduce conflict. But history is not encouraging in this respect. The bloodiest wars in history have been religious wars.

author: Elizabeth Blackwell
quote: A blank wall of social and professional antagonism faces the woman physician that forms a situation of singular and painful loneliness\\, leaving her without support\\, respect or professional counsel.

author: Michelle Obama
quote: If I made a commitment\\, I stood by that commitment - and try to make it real. Because when you become leaders\\, the most important thing you have is your word\\, your trust. That's where respect comes from.

author: Malcolm X
quote: In all our deeds\\, the proper value and respect for time determines success or failure.

author: Harvey Milk
quote: It takes no compromising to give people their rights. It takes no money to respect the individual. It takes no survey to remove repressions.

author: Jenna Morasca
quote: As human beings we value the experience that comes with age. We are reminded over and over again with statements like 'older and wiser' and 'respect your elders\\,' promoting age as something to be cherished and respected.

author: Larry Bird
quote: Leadership is diving for a loose ball\\, getting the crowd involved\\, getting other players involved. It's being able to take it as well as dish it out. That's the only way you're going to get respect from the players.

author: Jeff Ross
quote: People are roasting each other at parties\\, at work events\\, around the fire. It's so fun. People are busting each other's chops\\, and it's a sign of affection\\, truly. It's a true test of love and friendship: can you make a man laugh at himself? So what makes a good burn? Go after targets you love and respect. And hit 'em hard.

author: Ben Roethlisberger
quote: Leadership is something you earn\\, something you're chosen for. You can't come in yelling\\, 'I'm your leader!' If it happens\\, it's because the other guys respect you.

author: Amos Oz
quote: And in this respect\\, the Israeli-Palestinian conflict has been a tragedy\\, a clash between one very powerful\\, very convincing\\, very painful claim over this land and another no less powerful\\, no less convincing claim.

author: Sandra Day O'Connor
quote: Society as a whole benefits immeasurably from a climate in which all persons\\, regardless of race or gender\\, may have the opportunity to earn respect\\, responsibility\\, advancement and remuneration based on ability.

author: Martin Luther King\\, Jr.
quote: I submit that an individual who breaks a law that conscience tells him is unjust\\, and who willingly accepts the penalty of imprisonment in order to arouse the conscience of the community over its injustice\\, is in reality expressing the highest respect for law.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Everyone should be respected as an individual\\, but no one idolized.

author: Lord Byron
quote: There is no instinct like that of the heart.

author: Minna Antrim
quote: A beautiful woman delights the eye; a wise woman\\, the understanding; a pure one\\, the soul.

author: John Keats
quote: I love you the more in that I believe you had liked me for my own sake and for nothing else.

author: Richard Bach
quote: True love stories never have endings.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: Love recognizes no barriers. It jumps hurdles\\, leaps fences\\, penetrates walls to arrive at its destination full of hope.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: If you are not too long\\, I will wait here for you all my life.

author: William Blake
quote: I am in you and you in me\\, mutual in divine love.

author: Katharine Lee Bates
quote: Love planted a rose\\, and the world turned sweet.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
quote: All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream.

author: Frida Kahlo
quote: I love you more than my own skin.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Morning without you is a dwindled dawn.

author: Dorothy L. Sayers
quote: I love you - I am at rest with you - I have come home.

author: Luciano De Crescenzo
quote: We are each of us angels with only one wing\\, and we can only fly by embracing one another.

author: Charlie Chaplin
quote: A tramp\\, a gentleman\\, a poet\\, a dreamer\\, a lonely fellow\\, always hopeful of romance and adventure.

author: Ashton Kutcher
quote: Vulnerability is the essence of romance. It's the art of being uncalculated\\, the willingness to look foolish\\, the courage to say\\, 'This is me\\, and I'm interested in you enough to show you my flaws with the hope that you may embrace me for all that I am but\\, more important\\, all that I am not.'

author: Sylvia Plath
quote: Kiss me and you will see how important I am.

author: Stendhal
quote: If you don't love me\\, it does not matter\\, anyway I can love for both of us.

author: Jeremy Taylor
quote: Love is friendship set on fire.

author: Jane Austen
quote: There is no charm equal to tenderness of heart.

author: William Makepeace Thackeray
quote: When you look at me\\, when you think of me\\, I am in paradise.

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote: The real lover is the man who can thrill you just by touching your head or smiling into your eyes - or just by staring into space.

author: Antoine Predock
quote: The connection to place\\, to the land\\, the wind\\, the sun\\, stars\\, the moon... it sounds romantic\\, but it's true - the visceral experience of motion\\, of moving through time on some amazing machine - a few cars touch on it\\, but not too many compared to motorcycles. I always felt that any motorcycle journey was special.

author: Jennifer Aniston
quote: I think it's important to have closure in any relationship that ends - from a romantic relationship to a friendship. You should always have a sense of clarity at the end and know why it began and why it ended. You need that in your life to move cleanly into your next phase.

author: John Greenleaf Whittier
quote: Tradition wears a snowy beard\\, romance is always young.

author: Mae West
quote: A man's kiss is his signature.

author: Carolyn Gold Heilbrun
quote: Romance is the glamour which turns the dust of everyday life into a golden haze.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: And ever has it been known that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.

author: Christopher Marlowe
quote: O\\, thou art fairer than the evening air clad in the beauty of a thousand stars.

author: John Keats
quote: Heard melodies are sweet\\, but those unheard are sweeter.

author: Mariella Frostrup
quote: We invest less in our friendships and expect more of friends than any other relationship. We spend days working out where to book for a romantic dinner\\, weeks wondering how to celebrate a partner or parent's birthday\\, and seconds forgetting a friend's important anniversary.

author: William Makepeace Thackeray
quote: When I walk with you I feel as if I had a flower in my buttonhole.

author: Walter Dean Myers
quote: I joined the army on my seventeenth birthday\\, full of the romance of war after having read a lot of World War I British poetry and having seen a lot of post-World War II films. I thought the romantic presentations of war influenced my joining and my presentation of war to my younger siblings.

author: Ginnifer Goodwin
quote: I love Valentine's Day! I love it\\, I love it\\, I love it. I like having doors opened for me. My favorite romantic comedy is 'When Harry Met Sally.'

author: Paul Simon
quote: There's something about the sound of a train that's very romantic and nostalgic and hopeful.

author: Delilah
quote: A lot of times\\, in our culture and our society\\, we put romantic love somehow on a higher plane than self-love and friendship love. You can't do that. You have to honor and really fully invest in all these different loving relationships.

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: My heart is like a singing bird.

author: Melanie Fiona
quote: I am a bit of a hopeless romantic. I really do have a faith and a belief in love\\, and when I love\\, I love hard.

author: William Butler Yeats
quote: How far away the stars seem\\, and how far is our first kiss\\, and ah\\, how old my heart.

author: Roxane Gay
quote: Long walks on the beach are the supposed holy grail of a romantic evening. The beach becomes a kind of utopia - the place where all our dreams come true.

author: Alain de Botton
quote: The thing is that love gives us a ringside seat on somebody else's flaws\\, so of course you're gonna spot some things that kinda need to be mentioned. But often the romantic view is to say\\, 'If you loved me\\, you wouldn't criticise me.' Actually\\, true love is often about trying to teach someone how to be the best version of themselves.

author: Edmond de Goncourt
quote: Today I begin to understand what love must be\\, if it exists... When we are parted\\, we each feel the lack of the other half of ourselves. We are incomplete like a book in two volumes of which the first has been lost. That is what I imagine love to be: incompleteness in absence.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: When I give I give myself.

author: James Russell Lowell
quote: All the beautiful sentiments in the world weigh less than a single lovely action.

author: Alan Furst
quote: I love Paris for the million reasons that everybody loves the city. It's an incredibly romantic and beautiful place.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: If I can stop one heart from breaking\\, I shall not live in vain.

author: Rupert Brooke
quote: Breathless\\, we flung us on a windy hill\\, Laughed in the sun\\, and kissed the lovely grass.

author: Mignon McLaughlin
quote: Love is the silent saying and saying of a single name.

author: Lance Bass
quote: I think everyone dreams of that nice romantic wedding.

author: Tom Hanks
quote: You cannot look up at the night sky on the Planet Earth and not wonder what it's like to be up there amongst the stars. And I always look up at the moon and see it as the single most romantic place within the cosmos.

author: Halle Berry
quote: I'm not done with love\\, but I refuse to settle. I am a hopeless romantic. And I won't stop till I get it right.

author: Walter Hagen
quote: It is the addition of strangeness to beauty that constitutes the romantic character in art.

author: Oscar Hammerstein II
quote: Be brave\\, young lovers\\, and follow your star.

author: John Keats
quote: I am certain of nothing but the holiness of the heart's affections\\, and the truth of imagination.

author: D. H. Lawrence
quote: There is only one thing that a man really wants to do\\, all his life; and that is\\, to find his way to his God\\, his Morning Star\\, salute his fellow man\\, and enjoy the woman who has come the long way with him.

author: Robert Herrick
quote: What is a kiss? Why this\\, as some approve: The sure\\, sweet cement\\, glue\\, and lime of love.

author: Sinclair Lewis
quote: What is love? It is the morning and the evening star.

author: Christopher Marlowe
quote: Come live with me and be my love\\, And we will all the pleasures prove\\, That valleys\\, groves\\, hills\\, and fields\\, Woods\\, or steepy mountain yields.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.

author: John Greenleaf Whittier
quote: All the windows of my heart I open to the day.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: Of all the music that reached farthest into heaven\\, it is the beating of a loving heart.

author: Arthur Symons
quote: A realist\\, in Venice\\, would become a romantic by mere faithfulness to what he saw before him.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: The telephone\\, which interrupts the most serious conversations and cuts short the most weighty observations\\, has a romance of its own.

author: Kimberly Schlapman
quote: My personal decorating style is cozy\\, romantic and a little rustic\\, with a sense of whimsy.

author: Suzanne Brockmann
quote: The lust and attraction are often a given in a romance novel - I want to dig into the elements of true friendship that form a foundation for a solid\\, gonna-last-forever romantic relationship.

author: Rachael Taylor
quote: Falling in love\\, romance\\, matters of the heart - when you fall in love\\, on some biochemical level you know there is a chance it won't work out. It's ingrained in us that if you take such an enormous risk on someone with your heart that it might not pay off. I gamble all my chips and I might actually lose everything.

author: Billy Graham
quote: The word 'romance\\,' according to the dictionary\\, means excitement\\, adventure\\, and something extremely real. Romance should last a lifetime.

author: Poppy Delevingne
quote: All I ever wanted was to be a sexy bride\\, and actually\\, I think I've turned into a romantic bride.

author: Tom Robbins
quote: I have always been a romantic\\, one of those people who believes that a woman in pink circus tights contains all the secrets of the universe.

author: Thomas Wolfe
quote: Is this not the true romantic feeling; not to desire to escape life\\, but to prevent life from escaping you.

author: Trey Songz
quote: I once took the key off my girlfriend's key ring so that I could surprise her when she got home. So I did this whole romantic setup in our bedroom with flowers and rose petals. She was so mad when she got home\\, but then when she walked in\\, she was so surprised.

author: Jennifer Love Hewitt
quote: I'm a hopeless romantic. I love love. My middle name is Love. Valentine's Day is my favorite holiday. I want to have a family and children. I am a sucker for every romantic comedy that comes out.

author: Jack White
quote: Vinyl is the real deal. I've always felt like\\, until you buy the vinyl record\\, you don't really own the album. And it's not just me or a little pet thing or some kind of retro romantic thing from the past. It is still alive.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes\\, Sr.
quote: The sound of a kiss is not so loud as that of a cannon\\, but its echo lasts a great deal longer.

author: Mason Cooley
quote: Romance is tempestuous. Love is calm.

author: Alex Turner
quote: I am a romantic fool\\, no doubt about that.

author: Elizabeth Wurtzel
quote: I was meant to date the captain of the football team\\, I was going to be on a romantic excursion every Saturday night\\, I was destined to be collecting corsages from every boy in town before prom\\, accepting such floral offerings like competing sacrifices to a Delphic goddess.

author: Henry Rollins
quote: The ecstatic insanity of romantic pursuit can be so enhanced by music that entire romantic conquests\\, victories and ruinous\\, crushing defeats can be tied to songs to such a degree that it's almost unbearable to listen to them again\\, as they bring back the memories so vividly.

author: Carolina Herrera
quote: You feel very romantic when you're in a ball gown. Everyone should wear one once in a while.

author: Benjamin Bratt
quote: Building a little bonfire at night on the beach and lying on a blanket with my wife under the stars is not only sexy\\, it's romantic.

author: James Joyce
quote: Satan\\, really\\, is the romantic youth of Jesus re-appearing for a moment.

author: Luanne Rice
quote: 'Little Night' has layers of meaning. There's something enchanted about night. All those heavenly bodies\\, shooting stars\\, the crescent moon\\, celestial phenomenon. Owls fly at night\\, and first kisses happen. Night is romantic. Alternately\\, darkness hides the worst of human behavior.

author: Ayelet Waldman
quote: Is Valentine's Day a day to make cupcakes with your children? No\\, Valentine's is supposed to be a day about romantic love.

author: Gabriella Wilde
quote: I'm not really a fan of Valentine's Day. I think it can be romantic doing nothing on Valentine's Day. It's more romantic than being given a big bunch of flowers that everyone else is doing.

author: Elisha Cuthbert
quote: There's nothing more romantic than Italian food.

author: Samuel Butler
quote: It is better to have loved and lost than never to have lost at all.

author: Anne Frank
quote: I have often been downcast but never in despair; I regard our hiding as a dangerous adventure\\, romantic and interesting at the same time. In my diary\\, I treat all the privations as amusing.

author: Wes Anderson
quote: Any romantic feelings for a 12-year-old are like entering into a fantasy world.

author: Jennifer Love Hewitt
quote: I'm a hopeless romantic. It's disgusting. It really is. I've seen 'While You Were Sleeping'\\, like\\, twenty times\\, and I still believe in the whole Prince Charming thing.

author: Robert Herrick
quote: Bid me to love\\, and I will give a loving heart to thee.

author: Christina Ricci
quote: My dream role would probably be a psycho killer\\, because the whole thing I love about movies is that you get to do things you could never do in real life\\, and that would be my way of vicariously experiencing being a psycho killer. Also\\, it's incredibly romantic.

author: Gerard Way
quote: There's something very romantic about self-destruction and sabotaging your life\\, and taking a hammer to it.

author: James Van Der Beek
quote: I'm not about to talk about what's romantic in my life - I figure if you talk about it once\\, then that's an open invitation for everyone to dig into your personal life even further. So\\, I just keep my private life to myself.

author: Harry Connick\\, Jr.
quote: It is really rare to find someone you really\\, really love and that you want to spend your life with and all that stuff that goes along with being married. I am one of those lucky people. And I think she feels that way too. So the romantic stuff is easy because you want them to be happy.

author: James Weldon Johnson
quote: The Southern whites are in many respects a great people. Looked at from a certain point of view\\, they are picturesque. If one will put oneself in a romantic frame of mind\\, one can admire their notions of chivalry and bravery and justice.

author: Irvin D. Yalom
quote: I do not like to work with patients who are in love. Perhaps it is because of envy - I\\, too\\, crave enchantment. Perhaps it is because love and psychotherapy are fundamentally incompatible. The good therapist fights darkness and seeks illumination\\, while romantic love is sustained by mystery and crumbles upon inspection.

author: Douglas Horton
quote: The more we are filled with thoughts of lust the less we find true romantic love.

author: Sarah Jessica Parker
quote: When men attempt bold gestures\\, generally it's considered romantic. When women do it\\, it's often considered desperate or psycho.

author: Darin Strauss
quote: After a life deprived of everything from romantic love to the choice of when to wake up in the morning\\, after 29 years without the ability to have a career or even to be alone at toilet\\, the Bijani sisters are not symbols but women who have had to live a shared life of constant\\, quotidian sacrifice.

author: Frank Waters
quote: The whole westward expansion myth is seen as romantic. But it's a joke\\, a blot on American history.

author: Louis Tomlinson
quote: I'm a very loyal boyfriend. I'm a bit of a joker... I can be romantic\\, but not too sickly.

author: Dita Von Teese
quote: Some days are just bad days\\, that's all. You have to experience sadness to know happiness\\, and I remind myself that not every day is going to be a good day\\, that's just the way it is!

author: Bonnie Blair
quote: It's sad to know I'm done. But looking back\\, I've got a lot of great memories.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
quote: Tears come from the heart and not from the brain.

author: Paramahansa Yogananda
quote: Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes\\, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts.

author: Bob Marley
quote: The good times of today\\, are the sad thoughts of tomorrow.

author: Christopher Morley
quote: Heavy hearts\\, like heavy clouds in the sky\\, are best relieved by the letting of a little water.

author: Mario Teguh
quote: Never make a decision when you are upset\\, sad\\, jealous or in love.

author: Henry Rollins
quote: It's sad when someone you know becomes someone you knew.

author: Carl Jung
quote: The word 'happy' would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness.

author: Kirsten Dunst
quote: You can never control who you fall in love with\\, even when you're in the most sad\\, confused time of your life. You don't fall in love with people because they're fun. It just happens.

author: Taraji P. Henson
quote: Every human walks around with a certain kind of sadness. They may not wear it on their sleeves\\, but it's there if you look deep.

author: Alyssa Milano
quote: First\\, accept sadness. Realize that without losing\\, winning isn't so great.

author: Washington Irving
quote: There is a sacredness in tears. They are not the mark of weakness\\, but of power. They speak more eloquently than ten thousand tongues. They are the messengers of overwhelming grief\\, of deep contrition\\, and of unspeakable love.

author: Arthur Koestler
quote: Nothing is more sad than the death of an illusion.

author: Nana Mouskouri
quote: I do believe that if you haven't learnt about sadness\\, you cannot appreciate happiness.

author: Ernie Harwell
quote: It's time to say goodbye\\, but I think goodbyes are sad and I'd much rather say hello. Hello to a new adventure.

author: Rumi
quote: Don't grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding.

author: Dionne Warwick
quote: Crying is cleansing. There's a reason for tears\\, happiness or sadness.

author: Lynda Resnick
quote: When you wake up each morning\\, you can choose to be happy or choose to be sad. Unless some terrible catastrophe has occurred the night before\\, it is pretty much up to you. Tomorrow morning\\, when the sun shines through your window\\, choose to make it a happy day.

author: Franz Schubert
quote: Nobody understands another's sorrow\\, and nobody another's joy.

author: Jean Paul
quote: Sorrows are like thunderclouds\\, in the distance they look black\\, over our heads scarcely gray.

author: Rollo May
quote: Depression is the inability to construct a future.

author: Troy Polamalu
quote: There are times I am happy. There are times I am sad. But I always try to separate emotion from the need to reach for something stronger\\, deeper. And then no matter the emotion\\, I can reach for a stability that helps me accomplish what is the goal.

author: Jim Rohn
quote: The walls we build around us to keep sadness out also keeps out the joy.

author: Leo Buscaglia
quote: Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow\\, it only saps today of its joy.

author: Saadi
quote: The rose and the thorn\\, and sorrow and gladness are linked together.

author: Dorothy Thompson
quote: To have felt too much is to end in feeling nothing.

author: Freddie Highmore
quote: I'm not a sad person\\, upset the whole time\\, but I seem to be quite emotional.

author: Rumi
quote: You left and I cried tears of blood. My sorrow grows. Its not just that You left. But when You left my eyes went with You. Now\\, how will I cry?

author: Bill Blass
quote: Red is the ultimate cure for sadness.

author: Freddie Highmore
quote: When you're happy you don't always have to be laughing\\, and when you're sad you don't have to be crying; sometimes it's the opposite. You laugh when you're the most upset.

author: Kevin Bacon
quote: I really believe that all of us have a lot of darkness in our souls. Anger\\, rage\\, fear\\, sadness. I don't think that's only reserved for people who have horrible upbringings. I think it really exists and is part of the human condition. I think in the course of your life you figure out ways to deal with that.

author: William S. Burroughs
quote: In deep sadness there is no place for sentimentality.

author: James Marsden
quote: Everyone can have their heart broken. Even if you know the relationship isn't working\\, it's still sad. Even in a bad relationship\\, they're part of your life for a long time\\, and saying goodbye to that can be difficult.

author: Pierre Corneille
quote: We never taste a perfect joy; our happiest successes are mixed with sadness.

author: H. G. Wells
quote: Affliction comes to us\\, not to make us sad but sober; not to make us sorry but wise.

author: Morrie Schwartz
quote: Dying is only one thing to be sad over... Living unhappily is something else.

author: David Rockefeller
quote: I am convinced that material things can contribute a lot to making one's life pleasant\\, but\\, basically\\, if you do not have very good friends and relatives who matter to you\\, life will be really empty and sad and material things cease to be important.

author: Jean de La Fontaine
quote: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.

author: John Steinbeck
quote: A sad soul can kill quicker than a germ.

author: Mac Miller
quote: When you feel sad\\, it's okay. It's not the end of the world. Everyone has those days when you doubt yourself\\, and when you feel like everything you do sucks\\, but then there's those days when you feel like Superman. It's just the balance of the world. I just write to feel better.

author: Viggo Mortensen
quote: There's no excuse to be bored. Sad\\, yes. Angry\\, yes. Depressed\\, yes. Crazy\\, yes. But there's no excuse for boredom\\, ever.

author: Charles R. Swindoll
quote: A teardrop on earth summons the King of heaven.

author: Miguel de Unamuno
quote: It is sad not to love\\, but it is much sadder not to be able to love.

author: M. J. Rose
quote: I think Paris smells not just sweet but melancholy and curious\\, sometimes sad but always enticing and seductive. She's a city for the all senses\\, for artists and writers and musicians and dreamers\\, for fantasies\\, for long walks and wine and lovers and\\, yes\\, for mysteries.

author: John Greenleaf Whittier
quote: For all sad words of tongue and pen\\, The saddest are these\\, 'It might have been'.

author: Ivo Andric
quote: Sadness is also a kind of defence.

author: Henry Louis Gates
quote: The sad truth is that the civil rights movement cannot be reborn until we identify the causes of black suffering\\, some of them self-inflicted. Why can't black leaders organize rallies around responsible sexuality\\, birth within marriage\\, parents reading to their children and students staying in school and doing homework?

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
quote: Our sweetest songs are those that tell of saddest thought.

author: Anne Bronte
quote: Oh\\, I am very weary\\, Though tears no longer flow; My eyes are tired of weeping\\, My heart is sick of woe.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
quote: Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad.

author: Conor Oberst
quote: I've cried\\, and you'd think I'd be better for it\\, but the sadness just sleeps\\, and it stays in my spine the rest of my life.

author: Virginia Satir
quote: Every word\\, facial expression\\, gesture\\, or action on the part of a parent gives the child some message about self-worth. It is sad that so many parents don't realize what messages they are sending.

author: Norman Cousins
quote: The tragedy of life is in what dies inside a man while he lives - the death of genuine feeling\\, the death of inspired response\\, the awareness that makes it possible to feel the pain or the glory of other men in yourself.

author: Mel B
quote: I've always been pretty independent\\, no matter what situation: good\\, bad\\, ugly\\, happy\\, sad. I dig deep\\, and I get over it.

author: Sylvia Plath
quote: I have the choice of being constantly active and happy or introspectively passive and sad.

author: Kendall Jenner
quote: I think social media has taken over for our generation. It's a big part of our lives\\, and it's kind of sad.

author: Audrey Hepburn
quote: If my world were to cave in tomorrow\\, I would look back on all the pleasures\\, excitements and worthwhilenesses I have been lucky enough to have had. Not the sadness\\, not my miscarriages or my father leaving home\\, but the joy of everything else. It will have been enough.

author: Ariel Sharon
quote: The sad and horrible conclusion is that no one cared that Jews were being murdered... This is the Jewish lesson of the Holocaust and this is the lesson which Auschwitz taught us.

author: Chief Joseph
quote: Hear me\\, my chiefs! I am tired. My heart is sick and sad. From where the sun now stands\\, I will fight no more forever.

author: Kimberly Elise
quote: I'm very free with all my emotions\\, whether it's happy\\, sad\\, mad\\, glad\\, whatever.

author: Rainn Wilson
quote: I know what I look like - a weird\\, sad clown puppet. I'm fine with that.

author: Hannah Arendt
quote: The sad truth is that most evil is done by people who never make up their minds to be good or evil.

author: Mark Twain
quote: There is no sadder sight than a young pessimist.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quote: It is sadder to find the past again and find it inadequate to the present than it is to have it elude you and remain forever a harmonious conception of memory.

author: Alfred Austin
quote: Tears are the summer showers to the soul.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Make the most of your regrets; never smother your sorrow\\, but tend and cherish it till it comes to have a separate and integral interest. To regret deeply is to live afresh.

author: Lauren Potter
quote: I've had tons of bullies who would call me retarded\\, even on my Facebook page. It's sad and it really hurts. I want to tell people not to use the word. Don't say your friend's retarded when they do something foolish. If you have a disability\\, keep working hard. Whatever it takes\\, do it\\, and don't be mean to people.

author: Jane Goodall
quote: The tree I had in the garden as a child\\, my beech tree\\, I used to climb up there and spend hours. I took my homework up there\\, my books\\, I went up there if I was sad\\, and it just felt very good to be up there among the green leaves and the birds and the sky.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.

author: Tyler\\, The Creator
quote: I don't like people around me sad. I like making people happy.

author: Yoko Ono
quote: Experiencing sadness and anger can make you feel more creative\\, and by being creative\\, you can get beyond your pain or negativity.

author: Shakira
quote: I never made it to the school choir because the music teacher didn't like my voice. I was pretty sad. But he was probably right; I did have a voice a bit like a goat\\, but my dad told me to never give up and to keep going\\, and it's paid off.

author: Sam Smith
quote: I've had an amazing life\\, but I think I was born with a little bit of sadness in me. I've always been attracted to those things\\, whether it's sad movies\\, sad music... when you're sad\\, you feel everything in a greater way than you do when you're happy.

author: Cilla Black
quote: It's hard to watch your life unfold\\, and sad. Life changes.

author: Emile Durkheim
quote: The Christian conceives of his abode on Earth in no more delightful colors than the Jainist sectarian. He sees in it only a time of sad trial; he also thinks that his true country is not of this world.

author: Golda Meir
quote: Those who don't know how to weep with their whole heart\\, don't know how to laugh either.

author: Harry Connick\\, Jr.
quote: There are more than 300\\,000 families in the Gulf region that lost their homes and are waiting for peace of mind. The hurricane exposed the sad reality of poverty in America. We saw\\, in all its horrific detail\\, the vulnerabilities of living in inadequate housing and the heartbreak of losing one's home.

author: Jeff Ament
quote: I love sad. Sadness makes you feel more than anything.

author: Phillips Brooks
quote: Sad will be the day for any man when he becomes contented with the thoughts he is thinking and the deeds he is doing - where there is not forever beating at the doors of his soul some great desire to do something larger; which he knows he was meant and made to do.

author: Reinhold Niebuhr
quote: The sad duty of politics is to establish justice in a sinful world.

author: Willie Nelson
quote: It doesn't hurt to feel sad from time to time.

author: Katha Pollitt
quote: I think the meaning of abortion is what the woman says it is: For a woman who wants a child but can't have this one\\, it can be sad; for a woman who doesn't want a baby\\, it can feel like a huge relief\\, like having your whole life given back to you.

author: Gloria Estefan
quote: The sad truth is that opportunity doesn't knock twice.

author: Tim Schafer
quote: People talk about games and loneliness - it's a lonely activity. I didn't understand that. 'Gears of War' was the first multiplayer game for me that I enjoyed. But I wasn't sad. I liked being alone. I liked playing games by myself. I had lots of companionship at the house.

author: Horace
quote: Sad people dislike the happy\\, and the happy the sad; the quick thinking the sedate\\, and the careless the busy and industrious.

author: Umberto Eco
quote: Musical compositions can be very sad - Chopin - but you have the pleasure of this sadness. The cheap consolation is: you will be happy. The higher consolation is the pleasure and recognition of your unhappiness\\, the pleasure of having recognised that fate\\, destiny and life are such as they are and so you reach a higher form of consciousness.

author: G-Eazy
quote: You'd die very sad if you tried to make everyone in the world happy\\, you know what I mean? You can't; no one can.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: When you are joyous\\, look deep into your heart and you shall find it is only that which has given you sorrow that is giving you joy. When you are sorrowful look again in your heart\\, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight.

author: Deepika Padukone
quote: Being sad and being depressed are two different things. Also\\, people going through depression don't look so\\, while someone sad will look sad. The most common reaction is\\, 'How can you be depressed? You have everything going for you. You are the supposed number one heroine and have a plush home\\, car\\, movies... What else do you want?'

author: Letitia Elizabeth Landon
quote: Delicious tears! The heart's own dew.

author: Joseph Campbell
quote: Participate joyfully in the sorrows of the world. We cannot cure the world of sorrows\\, but we can choose to live in joy.

author: Jackie Kennedy
quote: One must not let oneself be overwhelmed by sadness.

author: Lionel Messi
quote: The day you think there is no improvements to be made is a sad one for any player.

author: Thomas Carlyle
quote: Wondrous is the strength of cheerfulness\\, and its power of endurance - the cheerful man will do more in the same time\\, will do it; better\\, will preserve it longer\\, than the sad or sullen.

author: Kevin Spacey
quote: I find it sad that by not talking about who I sleep with\\, that makes me mysterious. There was a time when I would have been called a gentleman.

author: Leo Buscaglia
quote: When we sit at the table\\, there is more going on than satisfying hunger. It is sad to think of those who eat simply to satisfy their hunger and who do not permit themselves to linger under the many spells offered by a good meal - the satisfaction of our hearts\\, our minds and our spirits.

author: Post Malone
quote: I was a sad kid.

author: Queen Victoria
quote: A marriage is no amusement but a solemn act\\, and generally a sad one.

author: Reba McEntire
quote: To succeed in life\\, you need three things: a wishbone\\, a backbone and a funny bone.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
quote: I love everything that's old\\, - old friends\\, old times\\, old manners\\, old books\\, old wine.

author: Socrates
quote: Our prayers should be for blessings in general\\, for God knows best what is good for us.

author: John O'Donohue
quote: A blessing is a circle of light drawn around a person to protect\\, heal and strengthen.

author: James McGreevey
quote: I try to be grateful for the abundance of the blessings that I have\\, for the journey that I'm on and to relish each day as a gift.

author: C. S. Lewis
quote: I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it\\, but because by it I see everything else.

author: Denzel Washington
quote: I say luck is when an opportunity comes along and you're prepared for it.

author: Joseph Brodsky
quote: Cherish your human connections: your relationships with friends and family.

author: Saint Patrick
quote: Christ beside me\\, Christ before me\\, Christ behind me\\, Christ within me\\, Christ beneath me\\, Christ above me.

author: Tennessee Williams
quote: Luck is believing you're lucky.

author: John O'Donohue
quote: The joyful heart sees and reads the world with a sense of freedom and graciousness.

author: William Butler Yeats
quote: Think where man's glory most begins and ends\\, and say my glory was I had such friends.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: We have always found the Irish a bit odd. They refuse to be English.

author: Thomas Moore
quote: Fond memory brings the light of other days around me.

author: Jimmy Dean
quote: You gotta try your luck at least once a day\\, because you could be going around lucky all day and not even know it.

author: Darrell Royal
quote: You've got to think lucky. If you fall into a mudhole\\, check your back pocket - you might have caught a fish.

author: William Butler Yeats
quote: Being Irish\\, he had an abiding sense of tragedy\\, which sustained him through temporary periods of joy.

author: Pope John Paul II
quote: Love is never defeated\\, and I could add\\, the history of Ireland proves it.

author: John Millington Synge
quote: There is no language like the Irish for soothing and quieting.

author: George William Russell
quote: Our hearts were drunk with a beauty Our eyes could never see.

author: Dave Barry
quote: Geographically\\, Ireland is a medium-sized rural island that is slowly but steadily being consumed by sheep.

author: Brendan Behan
quote: If it was raining soup\\, the Irish would go out with forks.

author: Victoria Smurfit
quote: If you're Irish\\, it doesn't matter where you go - you'll find family.

author: Colin Farrell
quote: Being Irish is very much a part of who I am. I take it everywhere with me.

author: Lara Flynn Boyle
quote: That's what the holidays are for - for one person to tell the stories and another to dispute them. Isn't that the Irish way?

author: Brian Dennehy
quote: I come from an Irish Catholic family\\, and hell-raising is part of the DNA.

author: Shane Leslie
quote: Every St. Patrick's Day every Irishman goes out to find another Irishman to make a speech to.

author: Kenneth Branagh
quote: Being Irish\\, I always had this love of words.

author: John Boyle O'Reilly
quote: Be true to your work\\, your word\\, and your friend.

author: Maureen O'Hara
quote: Above all else\\, deep in my soul\\, I'm a tough Irishwoman.

author: Anne Enright
quote: I was raised in a very old fashioned Ireland where women were reared to be lovely.

author: Reba McEntire
quote: To succeed in life\\, you need three things: a wishbone\\, a backbone and a funny bone.

quote: I love everything that's old\\, - old friends\\, old times\\, old manners\\, old books\\, old wine.

quote: You gotta try your luck at least once a day\\, because you could be going around lucky all day and not even know it.

author: Darrell Royal
quote: You've got to think lucky. If you fall into a mudhole\\, check your back pocket - you might have caught a fish.

author: William Butler Yeats
quote: Being Irish\\, he had an abiding sense of tragedy\\, which sustained him through temporary periods of joy.

author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam
quote: Science is a beautiful gift to humanity; we should not distort it.

author: Edward Teller
quote: The science of today is the technology of tomorrow.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Only two things are infinite\\, the universe and human stupidity\\, and I'm not sure about the former.

author: Carl Sagan
quote: Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Science without religion is lame\\, religion without science is blind.

author: Immanuel Kant
quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.

author: Thomas Berger
quote: The art and science of asking questions is the source of all knowledge.

author: Martin Luther King\\, Jr.
quote: Our scientific power has outrun our spiritual power. We have guided missiles and misguided men.

author: Katherine Johnson
quote: We will always have STEM with us. Some things will drop out of the public eye and will go away\\, but there will always be science\\, engineering\\, and technology. And there will always\\, always be mathematics.

author: Wernher von Braun
quote: Research is what I'm doing when I don't know what I'm doing.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science.

author: Henry Petroski
quote: Science is about knowing; engineering is about doing.

author: Charles Darwin
quote: Ignorance more frequently begets confidence than does knowledge: it is those who know little\\, and not those who know much\\, who so positively assert that this or that problem will never be solved by science.

author: Nikola Tesla
quote: Modern science says: 'The sun is the past\\, the earth is the present\\, the moon is the future.' From an incandescent mass we have originated\\, and into a frozen mass we shall turn. Merciless is the law of nature\\, and rapidly and irresistibly we are drawn to our doom.

author: William Osler
quote: Medicine is a science of uncertainty and an art of probability.

author: Carl Sagan
quote: We live in a society exquisitely dependent on science and technology\\, in which hardly anyone knows anything about science and technology.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Success is a science; if you have the conditions\\, you get the result.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss.

author: Adam Smith
quote: Science is the great antidote to the poison of enthusiasm and superstition.

author: Edsger Dijkstra
quote: Computer science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
quote: Science has not yet taught us if madness is or is not the sublimity of the intelligence.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
quote: Everything is theoretically impossible\\, until it is done.

author: Heinrich Rohrer
quote: Science means constantly walking a tightrope between blind faith and curiosity; between expertise and creativity; between bias and openness; between experience and epiphany; between ambition and passion; and between arrogance and conviction - in short\\, between an old today and a new tomorrow.

author: Fidel Castro
